All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AppTest
Unit test for simple App.
AskFullMsg
The server uses this message to send to the client the board and the player's shelf.
For example, the sever sends this message at the start and the finish of the player's turn.
AskNicknameMessage
Used b the server to ask the player for its name.
Board
Class that describes the usage and the methods of the board component of the game It contains the grid itself, his filling method, methods used to access its attributes and other support methods
BoardTest
 
Cli
View by commandline
ClientApp
 
ClientConnection
Is the abstract class where are defined the core method used by the client to communicate with the server.
ClientRmi
 
ClientSocket
This class is used to communicate with the server, is purpose is to act as a blackbox for the NetworkHandler, which receives and sends messages
CommonObj
Functional interface that implements the common objectives.
Coords
Support class for the method adjacent tiles
DeckOfPrivateObjectives
Deck of Private Objectives, it's a list containing all the possible objectives
DeckOfPrivateObjectiveTest
 
DeckOfPublicObjectives
Class that contains all the common objectives
ElementObjective
basic element of the private objective to assign points, it has the coordinates and type of the virtual tile of the shelf
EndGameMessage
Message that indicates that the game has ended or has been suspended
EndStatsMessage
Message from server to client
It contains the maps with the player end points and the common objective completion
ErrorMessage
Error message
FullTileSelectionMessage
Used to communicate to the server the selected tiles from the board, and the selected column where the player wants to place their tiles.
Game
Class that describes the game, all of its most important methods and attributes It contains all the data and information necessary to permit the game to be saved and resumed if interrupted This class is also used to initialize all the components at the very beginning of every game and keeping them updated
GameController
Controller class for the game
It is used server-side.
GameState
States in where the game can be
GameTest
 
GameView
Class used to print game-related content
GenericSceneController
 
Gui
 
Gui2
 
JavaFXGui
Main JavaFX class which starts the main stage and scene.
MainSceneController
 
MaxNumPlayerRequestMsg
Request the first player connected to the server the maximum number of the player for that game.
MaxPlayerSceneController
 
MenuSceneController
 
Message
Message class It has two attributes: the type of the message and the username of the player involved
MsgType
Enumeration of all the messages' types
MyRemoteInterface
 
NetworkHandler
 
NetworkHandlerTaskqueue
 
NumberOfPlayerMessage
When the first player connects to the server, the first thing he sends is the number of players for the game
Observable
Class use for notifying the class that implements the observer interface
Observer
 
Player
Class that describes the player, it contains the nickname, the player's point, the player's shelf, the player private objective and two flags that points out whether the player has done the public objective The class has the methods to put the tile in a certain column, to modify the flags, to add points to the actual points
PlayerTest
 
PrivateObjective
the Private objective a solution to "hardcoding" the ElementObjectives inside the constructor it adds predefined elements according to an id
PrivateObjectiveMessage
Send to the player the PrivateObjective.
PrivateObjectiveTest
 
PublicObjective
Class that contains a common objective and its realization
PublicObjectiveMessage
Send the player the PublicObjective
PublicObjectiveTest
This class tests the PublicObjective methods.
PubObjType
Represent the types which a public/common Objective can be.
RmiServant
 
RmiServer
 
SackOfTiles
Class that contains all the tiles to insert on the board
SackOfTilesTest
 
SerializableOptional<T>
Re-implementation of the Optional but serializable.
If the value is ot null isEmpty return false, and the isPresent returns true.

The methods in the class are a copy of the original methods.
The only method different from the original is of(T value), which if the value is null return an empty SerializableOptional otherwise returns a SerializableOptional with its value equals to the value passed.
Server
 
ServerApp
Class that runs the server
ServerConnection
Abstract class containing the methods which the server uses to read and send messages from the client.
Shelf
Class that describes a player's shelf, with methods to return the infos about it, and the method for inserting a tile in given column
ShelfTest
 
SocketServer
Class that handles the communication between server and client It communicates with one client only Each client will have its own realization of this class
Space
 
SpaceTest
This class tests the PublicObjective methods.
StartSceneController
 
TextMessage
Sends to the player a String
Tile
Class that represent the single tiles that can be placed on the board and on the player shelves
TileTest
 
TurnState
Types of phases during a player's turn
Type
Represent the type which a Tile can be.
UpdateBoardMessage
Message from server to the client, notifying to update its it.polimi.ingsw.view to update the board
It sends the information about the updated board.
UpdatePlInfoMessage
Message from client to server, notifying to update the nickname of the sender player
It sends the new nickname
UpdateShelfMessage
Message from server to the client, notifying to update its it.polimi.ingsw.view to update the shelf
It sends the information about the updated shelf.
UsernameSceneController
 
View
 
ViewObservable
 
ViewObserver
Observer interface with the methods from the it.polimi.ingsw.view
VirtualView
Class that acts like a view for the server, it handles the "unpackaging" and "packaging" of the messages from and to the client
